body: What an interesting concept? Shide no Tori but the reincarnated being keeps wanting to be with her loved one but never manages to live long enough.
@sheza man you sound like an idiot getting that excited

@newtorise3 YOU FUCKING DUMB ASS, IT LITTERALLY SAID THERE THAT ITS NOT HER REINCARNATIONS BUT HER DESCENDANTS INSTEAD

DID YOU EVEN FUCKING READ IT?!

This hit my feeling hard like tony montana get shotgun'd from the back , heck i was fucking around local csgo group on facebook and i found this gem code . Come for curious , leave with half broke heart while tear start roll down for how wholesome the end was .

body: Ah, it's raining..
the song got me more than the doujin ngl
Man, this one realy had me crying.
This made me soft as a pillow and my heart hurts
I don’t come here to cry, goddammit.... :’(
P A I N  P E K O
like the first and second girls did because love is something rather felt and not handed down. you get it now @degweeb?

@degweeb so essentially, the first girl or “incarnation” is and was the only one that loved him truly from the beginning. However, she was married off to someone else and gave him the false idea she could reincarnate and be able to love him in her second life. The second girl is actually her descendant and not her so it turns out she lied for his sake as a way to make it up to him for not keeping the promise of marriage and not being able to live a long life with him. This second girl was able to give him a child but died early as well as the family line has a very weak physique it seems. The second girl seems to have loved him and in a way, the man did as well but it was kinda screwed since it turned out the second girl only loved him due to that scroll left by the first girl. The third girl is his daughter and he reveals he read the scroll and understood the first girl wanted her descendants to love him in her place but he tells the third girl that she is not obligated to love him
Damn this is more emotional than i want to admit.
Dude I didn’t even need post nut clarity to cry
